I kind of feel the entire upgrade thing is a lie. I am in IT and upgrades are never performed in the middle of the day especially during the business week when use its at its daily peaks. It is something that is usually done late at night when there is the least amount of use. Also before upgrades are rolled out they are usually throughly tested on staging servers and then rolled out to production servers. So the fact that they are saying it was due to an upgrade sounds kind of reckless to me since it was done during a business day during peak usage times.

No, It's all of us. Your welcome.

A device acquired from Verizon that boosts or extends cell signal in your home. Hooks up to your broadband (Ethernet or WiFi) and needs to be close to a window to have line of sight to GPS satellite. If you get lots of dropped calls and 1 bar or less signal in your home or property, then this can help.
